_description: This case models a scenario where the investment underperforms expectations with only 40% average occupancy (vs 70% base case). After 6 years of poor performance, the owners decide to exit the investment early. This tests the impact of early exit and poor operational performance.

_case_metadata.description: 40% occupancy, exit at year 6. Tests impact of underperformance and early sale.

financing._explanation: Financing assumptions remain the same as base case.

rental._explanation: Rental assumptions reflect poor performance with only 40% average occupancy across all seasons. This represents significant underperformance compared to base case expectations.

seasonal._explanation: All seasons set to 40% occupancy to reflect poor overall performance. This could be due to market conditions, property issues, management problems, or external factors.

winter_peak.name: Winter Peak (Ski Season)
winter_peak._occupancy_rate_explanation: 40% occupancy (down from 70% base case). Poor winter performance significantly impacts revenue since winter has the highest rates (250 CHF/night).

summer_peak.name: Summer Peak (Hiking Season)
summer_peak._occupancy_rate_explanation: 40% occupancy (down from 70% base case). Poor summer performance reduces revenue during the second-highest demand period.

offpeak.name: Off-Peak (Shoulder Seasons)
offpeak._occupancy_rate_explanation: 40% occupancy (down from 70% base case). Poor off-peak performance further reduces overall revenue.

expenses._explanation: Expense assumptions remain the same as base case. Lower occupancy means fewer cleanings, but fixed costs remain.

tax._explanation: Tax assumptions for calculating after-tax returns on investment property income in Switzerland.
tax._marginal_tax_rate_explanation: 21% marginal tax rate for rental income. This represents the combined federal and cantonal tax rate applicable to investment property income in Switzerland.
tax._depreciation_rate_explanation: 2% annual depreciation rate on property value. In Switzerland, investment properties can be depreciated for tax purposes, typically 2-3% annually. This provides additional tax deductions beyond interest and operating expenses.

projection._explanation: Projection assumptions with early exit at year 6. Property is sold after 6 years due to poor performance and owner dissatisfaction.
projection._projection_years_explanation: 6-year projection period. Owners decide to exit after 6 years of poor performance (40% occupancy vs expected 70%). Early exit means less time for property appreciation and loan paydown to improve returns.
